content:
IMobileWebFormServices Interface

Definition

Defines an interface for a page designer component to obtain services from a designer host such as Visual Studio 2005 at design time. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public interface IMobileWebFormServices

Remarks

All methods in this interface are to be implemented by the design host and made available to designer components through this IMobileWebFormServices interface. Before attempting to use the methods in a custom designer component, verify that the design host actually implements the interface.

Methods

ClearUndoStack()

Clears all items in the designer host's Undo cache at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void ClearUndoStack ();

Remarks

Since the ClearUndoStack method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

GetCache(String,Object)

Gets an item from the cache of the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public object GetCache (string controlID, object key);
controlID
String

The ID for the container control.

key
Object

The key for the cache item.

Returns
Object

An object from the cache of the designer host.

Remarks

Since the GetCache method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

RefreshPageView()

Refreshes the page in the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RefreshPageView ();

Remarks

Since the RefreshPageView method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

SetCache(String,Object,Object)

Stores an object in the designer host's cache at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void SetCache (string controlID, object key, object value);
controlID
String

The ID of the container control.

key
Object

The key for the cache item.

value
Object

The item to store in the cache.

UpdateRenderingRecursive(Control)

Recursively updates the associated control and each of its child controls in the design host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void UpdateRenderingRecursive (System.Web.UI.Control rootControl);
rootControl
Control

The container control with which to begin the update.
